numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The graph compares the outlook on the future between two age groups.
2. The first age group consists of people who are 15 years old to 20 years old.
3. The second age group consists of people who are 40 years old or older.
4. The younger generation is more optimistic about the future of society than the older group.
6. I wonder what factors influence these results.
8. A lack of responsibilities may influence viewpoints.
9. Generational norms may influence these results.
10. The viewpoints of the generations may clash.
11. The older group may feel uncomfortable with the progression of the younger generation.
12. If the older group feels uncomfortable with the progression of the younger generation then the older group may be less optimistic.
13. Environmental issues may be a factor.
14. This topic relates to my community.
15. I am part of the younger generation.
17. The headline is: The Opposing Futures in the Eyes of Different Generations.
